metadata.titel_preek: God’s Alien Work in the Church

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God executes His 'alien work' (judgment/destruction) to dismantle human 'covenants with death' and establish His 'proper work' (salvation) through the cornerstone of Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: to do his deed — strange is his deed!
I am laying in Zion for a foundation a stone

object.identificatie: The establishment of Justice and Righteousness through the 'Proper Work' (Salvation).
tekstueel_bewijs: destruction is decreed, overflowing with righteousness

zender.identificatie: The Sovereign Will of God / The Word of the Lord
tekstueel_bewijs: I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord God of hosts
it pleased God... to save those who believe
to those who are called... Christ the power of God

helper.identificatie: The Cornerstone (Jesus Christ) / The 'Left Hand' (Judgment as a precursor to Grace)
tekstueel_bewijs: his right hand is well hidden in his left

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Covenant with Death' / Human Scoffing / False Refuges
tekstueel_bewijs: we have made a covenant with death
hail will sweep away the refuge of lies
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological 'agreement with Sheol' that requires divine destruction.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (Subject) navigating the 'contest' of divisions and trials by trusting God's heart when His hand is hidden.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Humility and Persistence in the 'High Calling'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response of humility is a consequence of recognizing God's primary action of judgment and grace.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Cornerstone → God ← Covenant with Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has consigned all men to disobedience

voorbeelden: it is our part to heed the call
we would rather make a covenant with death
it will be sheer terror to understand the message

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's sovereign power (Pouvoir) to act even through destruction, rendering human ability (Pouvoir) secondary to trust.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Alien Work) through the negation of ~S1 (Lies) to the realization of S1 (Grace) hidden within S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The Cross is the point where the Alien Work (Death) and Proper Work (Life) coincide.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; judgment is presented as a 'decree of destruction' that cannot be bypassed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor of both judgment and salvation. Human action is framed as a response to divine initiative.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: he can stand alongside the giants... I want to set another quotation.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: it pleased God through the foolishness of what we preach to save those who believe.
covenant with death, and with Sheol we have an agreement

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Lincoln and Luther are used not as moral templates to imitate, but as 'theological thinkers' who correctly perceived God's agency.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them theocentrically.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; shifting from the burden of 'fixing' the church to trusting God's governance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; God's work is 'alien' to human effort.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Alien Work' of the OT to the Cross of the NT is seamless and structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's 'left hand' (wrath) and 'right hand' (love).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: hail will sweep away the refuge of lies... your covenant with death will be annulled

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Father's decree and the Son's work than the Spirit's indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'covenant with death' that requires divine destruction.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The 'Alien Work' functions as a necessary narrative obstacle that only God can overcome.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Devoir (Must) in the conclusion.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (Ability) given by the Spirit.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention that the Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' to remain humble.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's Work) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (Humility).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the 'moralistic therapeutic deism' trap by insisting on the 'strangeness' of God's agency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the Lincoln/Luther illustrations, Greimas reveals that these actors serve the functional role of 'Savoir' (Knowledge) actants for the Subject (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 28; Greimas shows how the sermon's 'engine' mirrors the Cross-event.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Alien Work' is an actantial 'Opponent' that God uses as a 'Helper' to achieve the 'Object' of Righteousness.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Left Hand/Right Hand' metaphor to perfectly illustrate the Actantial Axis of Power.
